meanings.definition: Of a color intermediate between black and white, as of ashes or lead.
meanings.sent1: The sky turned grey before the storm.
meanings.sent2: She wore a grey sweater on the chilly day.
meanings.sent3: The grey cat blended perfectly with the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as grey as the rainy clouds above.
meanings.sent5: The grey elephant stood out among the green trees.

meanings.sent1: The meeting was rather grey and uneventful.
meanings.sent2: The grey office walls made the room feel boring.
meanings.sent3: His joke fell flat, leaving a grey atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent4: The grey routine of daily life seemed to drain all excitement.
meanings.sent5: Her grey expression showed no hint of emotion.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old photo greyed and lost its vibrancy.
meanings.sent2: She used a special dye to grey her hair for the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The paint started to grey as it dried on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The memories began to grey with age, fading into the past.
meanings.sent5: The sky began to grey as the sun set in the distance.
